author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Department of Employment and Training, Government of Tamil Nadu, has cautioned a nationalised bank against auctioning 9.25 acres of government property in Arakkonam.

In a press release, the department said the Vellore Collector had acquired a property measuring 16.35 acres from Tamil Nadu Steels and allotted it to the Government Industrial Training Institute, Arakkonam during 1984.

Of the 16.35 acres, patta was obtained for 7.10 acres in the name of the Principal, Government Industrial Training Institute, Arakkonam, while the patta for the remaining 9.25 acres was not transferred in favour of the institute.

Taking this into advantage, the management of Dennis Steels Ltd, Arakkonam encroached the 9.25 acres and mortgaged it with the State Bank of India, Ernakulam, Kerala. The bank has taken action to recover the mortgage loan from Dennis Steels Ltd by e-auctioning on January 19, the release said.

The claim of property is under dispute at Land Acquisition Original Petition filed before the District Judicial Magistrate, Arakkonam. The department has cautioned State Bank of India, Ernakulam, Kerala and Dennis Steels not to interfere in this issue till the disposal of the case.

It has also cautioned persons who purchase the 9.25 acres of government property on e-auction as they will be included as defendant in the case, the release said.
title: Dept. cautions bank against auctioning govt. property
